intro: Sabaudia erythraeae, commonly known as the Aegean sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Sabaudia erythraeae is often found in coastal areas and is a characteristic species of the Mediterranean flora.
